document_data.caption: A peltast disguised as a leather satchel.
document_data.name: Peltast
document_data.mainbody: '''Peltasts''' were a very rare form of amorphous creature.

Description.Greater Peltast:
A rarer form of peltast, '''greater peltasts''' resembled translucent rock crystals rather than leather. They were roughly the size of a human fist. Much like a peltast they could alter the shape of their bodies, making them resemble faceted [[gem]]stones valued by creatures, but they could also alter their internal hue.

No organs or structures were visible within a greater peltast's body, though any blood they ingested was visible. Their bodies also visibly grew upon digesting a certain amount of nutrients.

document_data.Personality: Peltasts had an average level of intelligence, while greater peltasts were exceptionally intelligent.

Abilities.Biological:
The skin of these creatures could sense vibrations, distinguish scents with acute sensitivity, and sense other peltasts from up to {{SI|40|ft|long=yes}} away. Their eyes could see from distances of up to {{SI|60|ft|long=yes}} with both normal vision and [[infravision]]. They moved by creeping along surfaces in a [[worm]]-like fashion. They were capable of sticking to surfaces, even when their bodies were oily or wet, but only if these surfaces were solid and non-living. They also could not bear the weight of their host when doing so.

Peltasts exuded a liquid that served as both an anesthetic and tissue softener. They were immune to most forms of [[poison]] and capable of neutralizing any within a host's bloodstream, feeding upon the venom itself.

Whenever immersed in water a peltast exuded any waste material within themselves. This would stain and poison the water they were immersed in, making whoever drank from it nauseated.
Abilities.Magical:
These creatures possessed a slight degree of [[magic resistance|magical resistance]], which they shared with their hosts. They also had a degree of resistance to [[fire]] and blunt weaponry.

Greater peltasts possessed magical abilities similar to the [[spell]]s ''[[suggestion]]'' and ''[[monster summoning VI]]''. They used these abilities to call hostile creatures against their host until a good material opportunity developed and influence creatures around them, thereby ensuring the maximum amount of bloodshed possible.

document_data.Combat: Peltasts skillfully used their liquid with pinpoint precision, opening small wounds within their host's skin in small, hidden areas. Through these holes they fed upon their host's blood-borne nutrients. Because of their liquid's anesthetic property the chances of a host noticing their feeding was extremely slim. Hosts were never known to take ill from their feeding. If removed from a host there was no telltale peeling, pulling, or blood.
document_data.History:
Around the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], a prominent moneylender in the city of [[Menzoberranzan]] named [[Nantlel|Nantlel of the Three Fingers]] was guarded by several monsters that included a greater peltast.

In the mid-14{{th}} century DR, peltasts could be found in many of the upper levels of [[Undermountain]]. They were especially prominent around direct connections to the surface city of [[Waterdeep]] and in the dim alleys of [[Skullport]]. Greater peltasts could be found in the lower levels of Undermountain to some degree. Around this time, common peltasts also infested the [[Deep Temple]] of [[Thalandar]] within Undermountain.

Around [[1359 DR]], greater peltasts were the masterminds behind an abandoned wayhouse trap in the [[Dernall Forest]] alongside other peltasts, a [[doppelganger]], and two [[mimic]]s. Around that same time, bandits in [[Darkhorn castle]] unknowingly had a greater peltast within their treasure hoard.

Society.Diet:
Peltasts fed upon the blood-borne nutrients of their hosts.

Greater peltasts preferred to feed upon creatures that were either dead, disabled, or sleeping.
Society.Homelands:
Peltasts could be found in a wide variety of lands, though they were typically found inside of dungeons and in urban areas. Especially urban areas with direct connections to dungeon settings or sewers.

Greater peltasts were often found hiding among gemstones.
Society.Relationships: Peltasts formed symbiotic relationships with creatures, keeping them alive and protecting them in return for the nutrients they fed from them. They were only known to make [[human]]s, [[goblinoid]]s, and [[humanoid]] creatures their hosts, considering [[demihuman]]s like [[elves]] and [[dwarves]] to be little more than a means of transportation to more suitable hosts. They typically would leave a host that was diseased.

document_data.Rumors & Legends: The Great Library of the [[House of the Moon]] was rumored to have a peltast hiding among its [[book]]s.<ref>
